text.0:
The WHO Foundation @thewhof has appointed @_AnilSoni as its inaugural CEO.
The Foundation, an independent grant-making agency, was launched in May 2020 to work alongside WHO & the global health community to address the world’s most pressing global health challenges. https://t.co/BrQtxg34Gc
text.1: .@thewhof will also become a key partner of the #COVID19 Solidarity response Fund, which has so far raised $238M from 650,000+ individuals, companies & philanthropies. I thank the @unfoundation & the Swiss Philanthropy Foundation for their partnership in this success so far.
text.2: .@thewhof seeks to complement & strengthen @WHO’s efforts to deliver #HealthForAll. It's a platform for new types of public-private engagement, aiming to invest in innovative initiatives that can advance WHO’s mission amidst an increasingly uncertain economic climate.
text.3: Congratulations, @_AnilSoni, on your new role as CEO of @thewhof. I am sure that your unique set of skills & experiences spanning the public & private sectors, will equip you to provide invaluable support to @WHO's mission & the billions of people who depend on it. https://t.co/U3XqlYFOL2
text.5:
"I would like to thank the @unfoundation and the Swiss Philanthropy Foundation for their partnership in the success of the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund so far"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/pSzUFKO3aT
text.6: "@thewhof will also become a key partner of the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund, which has so far raised $238 million from more than 650 thousand individuals, companies and philanthropies"-@DrTedros
text.7: "@_AnilSoni will play a vital role at a vital time, in supporting @thewhof to achieve its goal of raising $1 billion for global health over the next three years"-@DrTedros
text.8: "@_AnilSoni is an experienced global health expert, with experience in the public, private and non-profit sectors. His previous role was at Viatris, a pharmaceutical company, where he was head of global infectious diseases"-@DrTedros
text.9:
"In May 2020 I announced the creation of @thewhof, a new independent body to generate resources for the work of WHO from sources we have not accessed before. 
Today the Foundation announced the appointment of @_AnilSoni, as its 1st CEO, from the beginning of next year"-@DrTedros
text.10: "Shortly after my election as Director-General in 2017, we analysed WHO’s :money_bag: situation & saw that the Org. was too reliant on a handful of major donors. In 2018 we announced our plans to establish a Foundation to reduce that reliance by generating :money_bag: from new sources"-@DrTedros
text.11: "In the initial stages of rollout, with only a small proportion of a country’s population immunized it’s vital that governments, communities and individuals continue using proven public health tools"-@DrTedros #ACTogether
text.12: "As supply increases, the next groups would include those who have higher risk of severe disease because of their underlying conditions, and marginalized groups at higher risk"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #ACTogether
text.13: "People at highest risk of serious disease or death as a result of age are also a high priority group because protecting them will reduce severe disease and death and take the burden off health systems"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.14:
"These are not easy decisions.

Vaccinating #healthworkers who are at high risk of infection will help to protect them & the health system"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.15: "As countries plan to roll out #COVID19 vaccines in the coming weeks & months, we urge them to prioritize vaccinating those most in need, based on the Values Framework & Population Prioritization Roadmap issued by WHO’s Strategic Advisory Experts Group on Immunization"-@DrTedros
text.16: "Seroprevalence studies can help us to understand how long immunity from natural infection lasts, which could also help us to understand how long immunity from vaccination might last"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.17: "We continue to work with our global networks to better understand the proportion of the world’s population that has been exposed to this virus and how long immunity lasts in people who have been infected"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.18:
"So far more than 60 countries, incl. more than 40 low- & middle-income countries, are conducting one or more of these studies using WHO’s protocols.
We are providing technical, financial & operational support & building research capacities for these studies"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.19:
"In January, WHO launched the Unity studies, a global effort to standardize seroprevalence studies & the use of serologic tests"-@DrTedros #COVID19 

https://t.co/q80wxKA8Mq
text.20: "We are still learning how strong immune responses are in different populations and for how long this immune response lasts"-@DrTedros #COVID19
text.21:
"Despite their limitations, their results are fairly consistent: they tell us that most of the world’s population remains susceptible to infection with the #COVID19 virus"-@DrTedros 

https://t.co/Ke1sZZFYtt
text.22:
"Hundreds of seroprevalence studies have been done around the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:, which vary in quality, methods & the type of tests used.
Some follow people or populations over :timer_clock_selector: to show how an antibody response in the individual, or seroprevalence in populations, changes over time"-@DrTedros
text.23:
"To do that, seroprevalence studies are important, which look for antibodies in the blood of individuals, to evaluate the extent of infection in different populations"-@DrTedros #COVID19 

https://t.co/e0fWWl5rog
text.24:
"Last week I spoke about the importance of testing, which is vital for knowing where the #COVID19 virus is. 

But it’s also important to know where the virus has been, and how many people might have been infected without showing symptoms or being diagnosed by testing"-@DrTedros
text.26:
The term “virginity” is not a medical or scientific term.  Rather, the concept of “virginity” is a social, cultural and religious construct – one that reflects gender discrimination against women and girls.

Say NO to #VirginityTesting!

:backhand_index_pointing_right: https://t.co/gPE26Q1BrY

#16Days https://t.co/aoOGtOtBjb
text.27: Journalists play a vital role in informing the public on science, specifically vaccine, developments, in an unprecedented period of scientific publishing. We‘ve got some guidelines on accurate #COVID19 reporting. https://t.co/VAymXRKhp8
text.28: #COVID19 vaccines are finally within reach, with several breakthroughs on the horizon. But even after we have overcome the imminent challenges of sufficient supply, efficient rollout and equitable access, vaccine hesitancy will remain a stumbling block. https://t.co/syw6B6TDpT
